question: Two fly wheels are connected by a non-slipping belt as shown in the figure. I₁ = 4 kg m², r₁ = 20cm, I₂ = 20 kg m² and r₂ = 30cm. A torque of 10 Nm is applied on the smaller wheel. Then match the entries of column I with appropriate entries of column II.
images/e3b6a935-7d8b-4a3d-9c4e-123456789006_1.png
Column I:
(a) Angular acceleration of smaller wheel
(b) Torque on the larger wheel
(c) Angular acceleration of larger wheel
Column II:
(i) 5/3
(ii) 100/3
(iii) 5/2
choices: a - ii, b - iii, c - i
a - iii, b - i, c - ii
a - ii, b - i, c - iii
a - iii, b - ii, c - i
explanation: For smaller wheel: T₁ = I₁α₁ => 10 = 4α₁ => α₁ = 2.5 = 5/2 rad/s² (Matches iii).
Linear acceleration matches: a = r₁α₁ = r₂α₂ => 0.2 * 2.5 = 0.3 * α₂ => α₂ = 0.5/0.3 = 5/3 rad/s² (Matches i).
Torque on larger wheel (effective torque producing this acceleration): T₂ = I₂α₂ = 20 * 5/3 = 100/3 Nm (Matches ii).
